results.title: Efficacy of carvedilol in mild to moderate essential hypertension and effects on microalbuminuria: a multicenter, randomized, open-label, controlled study versus atenolol.
results.text_hl: At study end, 10% of the @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@carvedilol@@@ group and 37% of the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group complained of @<m>DISEASE_Cold_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000067390 @@@cold extremities@@@.

results.title: Effect of beta-adrenoceptor antagonists on prevalence of peripheral vascular symptoms in hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: The percentage of those questioned who were taking beta-adrenoceptor antagonists at the time was 54.6%. 2 @DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@Raynaud's phenomenon@@@ (P less than 0.05) and @<m>DISEASE_Cold_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000067390 @@@complaints of cold extremities@@@ (P less than 0.001) were significantly more frequent in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ than in @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@, 74.8% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ complained of @<m>DISEASE_Cold_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000067390 @@@cold extremities@@@. 3 Exposure to beta-adrenoceptor antagonists did not increase the prevalence of @DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@Raynaud's phenomenon@@@ in either @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@ or @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ in the study, but did increase the prevalence of @<m>DISEASE_Cold_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000067390 @@@cold extremities@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@ (P less than 0.001).
